content.detailedDescription: It begins with a ufo sighting in my backyard where i saw searchlights shining from the local scott air force base, then a black shadow jump from tree to tree about 40 feet in the air. that was march of 2009. during the same month an apparition of a tall body with a narrow chin face appeared to me through a cloud of tobacco smoke as i smoked a cigar in my backyard. then in spring 2010 i began to ghost hunt at my house as i took dozens of detailed photographs of paranormal phenomena (apparitions, shadows, orbs, and images emblazened into woodgrain walls and carpet). during this same time through the summer of 2010, i began to take pictures of these apparitions forming within the clouds as i walked. i have dozens of pictures of supernatural apparitions within cloud formations that i only noticed after taking these pictures of normal weather phenomena, and enhancing their contrast, shadows, and lighting on photoshop. these photographs are in no way falsified or a hoax. they are 100% real, and you can tell by zooming in around the apparitions and finding zero pixelation which would indicate tampering or introduction of a new layer. i'm attaching the best 3 in this report, but i have dozens more. i am also emailing your director and editor the rest of these photos in hopes that you'll contact me and we could possibly meet in person someday to discuss this. i've already spent 3 weeks in county jail and 9.5 months in a state mental hospital after repeatedly sending these photographs in emails to the local newschannel5 ksdk (nbc) in st. louis. i won't give up this fight for what is right until the american public are shown these images by the american media. i need your help. thank you and good day, your fellow countryman.
content.summary: I've been witnessing detailed cloud apparitions for over a year now.

content.detailedDescription: I was on my balconi when i noticed a plane light but more shining and no leding. it was flying in streight line in a moment there was a flash and the object has changed direction going up and disapeard. i was suprised and enthusiast. never have seen something like that
content.summary: Flying in streight line in a moment there was a flash and the object has changed

content.detailedDescription: Tuesday aug. 23 2011.Beautiful clear day with large white clouds. came out of my house and was walking down my sidewalk to pick up mail. i looked up to the northeast to see coming out of a very large white cloud an object that i could not recognize as anything i had seen before. when i saw this thing i was absolutely stunned and i remember thinking, what is that!!!???. i continued down my sidewalk and as i got to my driveway i saw it as it was heading to the opposite cloud.(going west) it looked like a rusty copper penny on its side. it looked like it had a small bulge in its middle. it did not bob, zigzag or emit any kind of lights or noise. it was completely silent. i could not fathom what i was seeing and did not know what to do. my husband and i have lived here for over 20 years and i have never seen anything like this in my life. i don't know what it is but i do know what it is not. it is not an airplane. it had no wings,no tail,no lights,no sound,no trail of exhaust. it was not a bird. it was not a hot air balloon because we have had balloons land across the street from our house many years ago. i know what one sounds like. i called the airport to see if anyone had sent up any kind of weather balloon and they had not. if anyone can tell me what this thing was/is i would certainly appreciate it. it was nothing i had ever seen before in my life. did someone send up some sort of balloon that looks like a ufo? i don't know. all i know is that this is consuming my thoughts and i just want to know what it is. i have always tried to have an open mind about these things and know that something is going on in the skies above us. i just don't know what. i went out and bought a camera and intend to keep it with me at all times. i will probably never see anything like this again but i will keep looking. last thought...I did not see anything in the paper about this or hear in the news. did anybody else see it and like me don't know who to call without appearing like a nut??? has anyone else seen anything like this object?
content.summary: Disk like object came out from cloud and traveled into another cloud.

content.detailedDescription:
While camping in whiltshire, (uk) i filmed flying lights around 230 metres away from me. strangely there was no sound coming from those lights, but i was able to hear cow, who wore much further than flying lights. 

i would like to know if anyone have ever seen such think? 

more details about this event you can find in the description of youtube video 
http://www.Youtube.Com/watch?V=oqhio0lw-pk
content.summary: Flying lights/object which made no sound.

content.detailedDescription:
I was girlfriend back yard. i heard crows looked up to see crows circling over trees in backyard. above them i see a white floating sphere, aspirin sized. it proceeds flat and moving very slow south..Looks like a plastic pab in wind.Suddenly it moves alittle faster and turns in an arc to the right and higher..It then turns downard aliitle..All of a sudden from the right comes what looks like a rectangle shaped cloud, like a dash of a cloud--it is moving very fast from the right and just misses the orb and speeds off to the left. we are atill looking at the white orb that now starts to descend towrds u...The rectangle cloud comes fast from the left and crosses the orbs path, as the starnge fast rectangle cloud just passes the orb a very bright glint from the 1pm high sun in the cloudless clear blue sky bouncing off the structure within the clud as it swings by--blinds us. very bright shiny silver glint. the cloud flies off to right at 3 times the speed of the fighter jets that fly at high altitude over my house. the orb is still descending back towards us and returns back to the original spot above the reesline in my back yard, it hazs now completed a colplete circle. it hovers there for a minute or 2 as i am pointing and we are excitetly talking about--what was that?  i run 25 feet to kithcen an binoculars--come out raise glasses and it is no loger visible. she tells me it just moved away behind the visible treeline.
i am atrained navy navigator and snoopy team observier. i know the differences between lights and objects--from a ship in high seas, bobbing up and down in the dark amongst other lights and objects- i have personally operated and been in jets and advanced systems as a boat driver a member of elite 6 man special boat unit ie riverrat..
u do not assume this is a non human craft--but the fact that they made no sound at all--hovered , moved and stopped atr will in any direction,... and that the white cloud shroud covered craft went from one side of the sky to the other and then back at high speeds--silently--makes me have no doubt that i have witnessed the interaction of not one but two highly intelligent and highly advanced ufos.
if y ou have any info regarding what i have seen--you must...Please reach out. thx-
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Saw a floating orb accelerate into slow arc.. a cloud shrouded rectangle straffed orb at high speed--orb turned back toward me, cloud returns from left and straffes orb, bright glint light, cloud goes away, orb comes to me hovers 3 minutes then goes

content.detailedDescription:
I was at work. i usually take a smoke break at about 10. i, in fact, looked at the clock before i went out. my job runs on keeping track of times, so i know it was 10. i usually like to go the the roof of our building so i can stargaze and the roof offers the least amount of street lights. 
   i was looking in the direction of the big dipper when i saw a large orange light(orb?) floating upwards.I thought for sure it was a star, then i kept watching and it slowly started floating up. i could tell because a star to the left of it was a reference point i used. it was floating very slowly-if i didn't have that star to the left i wouldn't have thought it was anything but a star. there were some clouds in the area and it seemed to go into a cloud. -or vanished. i stuck around and lit another smoke to see if i would see anything else-or to see it pop back out of the cloud-i could see the top of the cloud. it never came back out of the cloud.
   it was a solid light, no flickering or pulsing. i got very excited during the sighting, i was hoping to watch more. i gave myself another 10 minutes to look but never saw anything in the area. 
   i did go back out to the roof about an hour later to see if i was just looking at a star, but the clouds had moved and there was no stars like what i'd seen.
content.summary: Bright light floated up into clouds, had close star to refrence path

content.detailedDescription: I was stargazing, on the patio, an exceptionaly clear night. ibecame aware of a very bright light coming from over my right shoulder from the rear, nw direction. this light was the largest object in the sky,the brightest in the sky, and moving quite quickly towards the se. it appeared round or disc shaped,it was exceptionaly bright white and completely silent. i watched it move towards the se until it disappeared behind the tree line. it was not a meteor, the moon, or like anything i have ever seen in the adirondacks, i don't believe it could have been the int'l space station, the shape was wrong.There was no tail,besides it was much too slow to be a meteor.
content.summary: Very bright light travelling from nw to se, approx. 20-25 sec duration

content.detailedDescription:
I was waiting for my shuttle bus to college as i noticed a bright reddish bright light somewhat blinking but thought it was a airplane. its 5am and we are heading down the highway  now and i noticed a really small starlike thing moving and blinking like crazy then i seen two more of those and thought i was just seeing things.
at that moment i saw a huge diamond black/gray object  it had 5 red lights under it on each corner and one in the middle and 2 white lights on oppisite ends of the diamond object i was directly under it at this point i was frozen with shock at what i saw. there was another person with me including the driver but the other person was asleep and the driver was not paying attention. now recently i have seen 7 red orange orbs flying over vegas a few days ago. after my close enconter i was having an anxiety attack when i got to the school i had to go straight back home because i could not stop shaking  from what ive seen it scared me . you can choose not to believe me, but i know what i saw i can decribe every single detail of the bottom of the huge object. anyway as i was waiting for my ride back home i continued to watch the huge object hover the go up slowly and slowly headed towards the southern mountains. following along i seen the starlike objects flying crazy blinking white light till the dissappeared.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Seen 4 ufos over highway by my house and in the sky towards henderson.

content.detailedDescription:
I'm writing this now, still in shock and awe, with goose-bumps in tow, over the events that have taken place this past evening from august 30th, 2011 through this morning, august 31st, 2011.  it started around 9-9:30pm pst when my fianc��� and i went outside to our backyard to let our two dogs out.  let me preface this: i've recently gotten into amateur astronomy, and just bought my first telescope a mere 2 weeks ago following the purchase of a pair of astronomy goggles that just blew me away a few weeks before that.  with my new hobby, i've found myself looking up at the night more than i ever have before.  jupiter has been amazingly bright and clear lately and it was because of this reason that i took my astronomy goggles out back with me.

my fianc��� and i both commented on how abnormally clear and sharp the night sky was, almost as if someone had turned the focus knobs on the night sky and got rid of the typical atmospheric distortion we're used to seeing over las vegas.  there was no moon in the sky (at least from our vantage point), so the sky was deep and dark and it really made the stars and planets appear sharper and brighter than usual.  in fact, it was the first time i could clearly see the orion nebula with just my binoculars.

as we stood in our backyard, with my binoculars in hand, we were looking to the northeast towards the direction of jupiter when i noticed what i assumed to be a satellite, or maybe even the international space station, scooting quickly from north to east approximately 65-70 degrees above the horizon.  i followed it with my astronomy goggles and got a nice crisp view of it, however, it looked just like a bright star.  no sound, no contrail, nothing, and i could tell this object was very very high up.  there was no shape to it, just a bright pin point of light traveling across the sky.  while odd, the object didn't make any right turns or shoot laser beams out it's belly so we didn't get too excited over it, however this was just the start of the evening.  the object eventually moved out of site as the back-side of our house blocked our view of the object traveling farther east-southeast.

it was no more than a minute after the object left our field of sight when we both saw what had to have been the biggest shooting star we've ever seen.  it traveled in almost the exact same path as the object we first saw, except in the exact opposite direction (east to north).  unlike a typical shooting star that shows up as a little streak of light that lasts only a second or two (if you're lucky), this one had to have lasted a solid 9 or 10 seconds (count it out... that's a long time for something to streak across the sky!).  it looked far more like the shuttle re-entry than it did a typical shooting star with a flaming tail spanning easily 35-45 degrees over the sky.  my fianc��� and i both watched it until it seemed to explode into a few pieces over the northern horizon.  the whole thing looked eerily similar to the space shuttle columbia as it re-entered and tragically blew apart.  needless to say, this was bar none, the biggest "shooting star" we've ever seen.

again, this doesn't necessarily scream of e.T. yet, but again, this was just the beginning.  as if seeing these two objects traveling in opposite directions along the same trajectory and time wasn't weird enough, it couldn't have been more than 30 seconds after the first shooting star exploded that another shooting star shot across the sky!  this one wasn't as big as the first (and it didn't explode), but i noticed it because it came down along the exact same trajectory in the exact same part of the sky.  however, the strangest part was that it traveled along the same path, not of the first shooting star, but in the opposite direction along with the original object i saw.  i'm no expert, but common sense tells me if a shooting star follows 30 seconds behind a bigger shooting star it should be coming down in approximately the same direction, not the exact opposite direction, as one would assume the two are part of the same celestial object (or at least one of his friends or neighbors).  

we stayed outside for another 5 minutes or so before we had to get back inside because we had ordered a pizza.  we were so excited we saw what we thought to be a once in a life time shooting star, however i was still stuck on what the first object was and why in the world a shooting star would cross in a perpendicular path to another shooting star, and on top of that, why all 3 objects would appear along the same line in the sky all within a few minutes of each other.  this was all truly weird, but we had pizza to eat.

fast forward to 4:45am pst and it's time to let the pups out in the backyard again.  (we work from home, so we often turn nocturnal and wind up staying up all night.)

at this pre-dawn time, the night sky seemed even more impressive than it had in the evening prior.  it was crystal clear out and now jupiter was just about straight overhead, so i decided to go inside and grab my new 8" telescope to get some great views of jupiter (of which we did).  i brought my binoculars out with me so i could view the sky while my fianc��� took command of the telescope pointing straight up towards jupiter.  

i was looking in approximately the same area when i noticed another fast-moving point of light, like a star flying across the sky.  it was just like the first object i had seen last night, yet this time it was directly overhead traveling from the northwest to the southeast.  i immediately grabbed the astronomical goggles and locked on to it as it  flew past jupiter.  

this was the turning point of the night's events.  literally.

as i followed this object i noticed it start to change its trajectory towards the south.  it wasn't a sharp turn, but a smooth arched curve done at high speeds.  there was no visible change in the sharp point of light, no change in shape, no visible mechanical maneuver, no contrail, no nothing... just a perfectly smooth turn.   

it was at this point that another star came in to view of my binoculars.  as the object i was focused on turned slight right it passed near this other star, and that's when things really got interesting.  that star looked like every other star in the sky, but when the moving object passed close to it, the star started to move in an opposite direction towards the north!!  i could not believe what i was seeing, but it seemed as if this "star" reacted to the object flying close by and decided to scoot along elsewhere.  

i immediately decided to let the first object fly out of my binocular's field of view and i followed this new object that just went from a stand-still to flying across the sky.  i followed it for what couldn't have been more than a few seconds when another "star" decided to pack up and move locations!!  this object moved towards the west away from the second object.  i felt as if i had just turned the lights on and all of the celestial bugs scattered in different directions.  in fact they scattered so quickly that i lost site of the trio as i tried unsuccessfully to keep a lock on the 3rd and latest traveling star.  all of this happened in the approximate vicinity of jupiter which was almost directly over head just starting it's trip back down the sky.

after loosing site of the objects i went around to the side of our house to get a view of the southern part of the sky that our house blocks from the backyard to see if i could find the first object.  i quickly found it, put my binoculars back up to my eyes, and watched the object continue southward.  soon it began to dim as it traveled too far away, but it was at this point that i saw what may be the strangest thing of the night.

as i was trying to steady my hands to watch the point of light fly away, there was a flash of deep orange light (almost red) that appeared in the same area of the object i was watching.  it surprised me so much that i let out an audible gasp that my fiance heard - i had never seen anything like it.  it almost had a flame-like appearance to it, like someone trying to light a lighter, but fails, and you only get that first flash of a flame with nothing to follow.  it was that quick, in and out, and following that, i wasn't able to find any of the objects i had been following.

i stayed outside with my binoculars in hand until almost 6am to see if they would come back, and decided to head back inside when the daylight really started to diffuse the stars.  

that was about two hours ago, and i must say that the events of last night and early this morning will go down as the strangest events i've ever seen in the sky, in space, or even in general, to date.  i don't know if it was the crystal clear skies that enabled this view, but i doubt i'll ever see that much action in the skies again (although i sure hope to!).  

i can't say for certain what this was, and i don't know if the "shooting stars" had anything to do with it or whether they were just a mere coincidence (of epic proportions), but the hairs on my back and the tingle in my spine tell me i saw something very unique and very strange last night, and luckily i had my fianc��� there to back me up and let me know i wasn't imaging things.

let me just say that i'll never look at a little star in the night sky the same, because as i found out, little stars aren't always what they appear to be.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: 5 ufo's seen over las vegas on ultra-clear night along with strange shooting stars

content.detailedDescription:
I saw it come out of the clouds, do a circle then stop, then i ran inside to get the camera and this is what you see.

iss did not fly over at this time and is not visible during the day.
it was not a weather balloon nor a plane.

so, what is it?
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.shape: Cone,   Circle,   Cylinder,   Disc,   Flash,   Oval,   Saturn-like,   Sphere,   Star-like
content.summary: Ufo caught on video houston texas aug 29 2011

content.detailedDescription: As soon as the fight jet went straight up in the sky, every one around notice 2 sphere lights glowing, nobody thought that was a ufo because of many airplanes doing acrobats. i was recording with my iphone 3gs, when i notice the lights thinking that was another airplane, but the jet went up and down, but the lights stayed for about 5 minutes and than disappear. i asked everyone around if they saw, and everyone saw the light.
content.summary: Air and sea show event, many people witness the 2 sphere lights.

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving home at approximately 11:00 p.M. on m-46 from saginaw, mi headed toward ithaca, mi when i noticed a off to the south above fielded area that was flashing blue and red as i thought i was approaching it, it disappeared.  i then turned south down a side road, and looked out the drivers window to the east, and i saw this huge star-like bright, glowing object that looked completely out of place to be a star and almost seemed too low to the ground to be a star.  

i was the only one on the roads this late at night and was starting to get a little freaked out as i noticed the object seemed to be getting closer to me and getting larger.  i called someone to step outside to see if they also could see the object and they did and they were about an hour from where i was.  therefore, it must of been high enough in the sky to be seen elsewhere.

it appeared to move slightly closer to the surface of the earth and then moved upward again.

i was driving (alone in the dark) i started to feel scared like i was being followed or watched.

i arrived home about 2:00 a.M. and the object was still in the sky.  it was higher up and not as large as it was originally, but was still very bright.  i did notice as the night went on the object did not move from its original location.  with the constant rotation of the earth and stars, i found it weird that the object did not move from its original position.
content.summary: Bright bright white light in eastern sky

content.detailedDescription:
I was walking home from my friends house, when out of the corner of my eye i saw what i thought was a shooting star. first thought i turned around to make a wish on it and that's when i saw that it was really big for being a meteorite. it was heading in from the west going towards the east starting about 70 degrees above the horizon and lost site of it no thanks to the roof of a house when it was at about 50 degrees. heading in a straight line, speed and apparent size it couldn't have hit more than a couple miles from me at the most, and if it had been a meteorite i'm very sure that i would have felt the ground shake from that kind of impact of one that big. so i waited about a minute and felt nothing.

it was moving way to fast and happened to quickly for me to get a picture, but like any intelligent person i didn't move at all and took a picture of where i saw it go through to try to figure out the path it took and later on try to figure out where it landed. 

after doing all of this i immediately called my friend, whos house i just left to tell him what happened. my phone says i placed that call at 3:42 am (new york time).
content.summary: Big, meteorite like speed, bright flourescent sea green like color, close to if not perfectly round.

content.detailedDescription:
Went on a night hike with boyfriend and sister off saddle peak road just north of topanga canyon in los angeles, ca. hanging out, star-gazing, and taking night photos with great views of los angeles (at close to 2600'). noticed 3 very bright yellow lights to the n, ne that appeared to be hovering, but figured they could be helicopters or planes moving directly toward us in some sort of formation. then a fourth light blinked into view next to the other 3 and we noticed a 5th bright yellow light away from the group to the nw. tried viewing through binoculars, saw no blinking, just steady bright yellow/white light. called to my sister, who had her camera set up on a tripod, and told her to zoom in and take a picture to see if we could tell what they were. as she was switching lenses and trying to get a photo, all three of us saw a large, bright green-blue orb of light very rapidly descend as if free-falling over by the 5th light to the nw. it moved in a straight line down and slightly to the north then blinked out while still in the sky. no clouds were in that area and we saw no meteor-like "tail" on the blue-green orb. it seemed way too close and large to be a meteor and appeared to be about 45 degrees above the horizon. my sister and i saw it from start to finish and my boyfriend, who was initially facing me, saw my reaction and turned to look in the same direction in time to see most of the descent and the blinking out.

immediately afterwards, we were all amazed by what we had just witnessed and were basically repeating to each other, "holy *$#!+, what was that?!" we heard a bunch of dogs barking in the distance and, within less than 5 minutes of the event, we counted at least 7-10 aircraft in the immediate vicinity, with the typical flashing/strobing lights. an additional two planes flew almost directly over us at very low altitude with almost no discernible engine noise. these planes had a bright white unblinking light at what appeared to be the tip of each wing, 2 white unblinking lights toward the front, and one red light that blinked on occasionally in the middle. no red/green navigation lights. although we didn't get photo/video of blue-green orb, we have video of aircraft response immediately afterwards and pictures of the bright yellow orbs that appeared before the incident. 

we continued to see an unusual number of aircraft in the area and also to the west, over the ocean, for the 30-40 minutes we stayed out there. then, on the drive back, we noticed a bunch of aircraft that seemed to be hovering or moving very slowly over the ocean. we checked webtrak once we got home and it showed nowhere near the number of aircraft that we counted in the area. we also noticed that flights in the area - perhaps coincidentally - diverted from typical flight paths observed at the same time on other nights. 

we are all very mystified by this event and want to know if anyone else witnessed it or has information that can help explain it.


my boyfriend also wrote a description of the event: 

"around a quarter to ten on august 21, 2011 (i'd say between 9:45 and 9:51), we were out stargazing in the hills between topanga canyon and malibu. there were patchy clouds and low-hanging mist along the coast, but the area in which we saw the object was certainly clear. turning at the reaction of my girlfriend, i caught the object (whose undetermined proximity to us felt much closer than any craft or meteor) halfway through its brief descent before it abruptly dematerialized. the object was bright, though a white solid body was visible amidst a glow that changed from yellow to green just prior to its disappearance. i perceived no tail, which would normally indicate a meteor or a small fireball. before and after this incident, but especially after, the sky was pockmarked with the lights of aircraft which did not register on flight tracks later investigated. not long before the object appeared, we noticed a strange pattern of various aircraft suddenly "winking on" one after another (as if someone were flipping switches) without any previous indication of their presence."
content.summary: Bright yellow orbs, then blue-green orb

content.detailedDescription: On monday august 29th at 1210 am i left my residence on my bicycle and headed towards the bridge and downtown. as i approached the crest of the hill i spotted a large red fireball hovering above the river ( also near a national guard base interestingly enough). at first i figured that it was a cell tower, but reason told me that i been on this road a hundred times at night and there are no cell towers that close and bright. desending down the hill i crossed the bridge and i sincerely felt the object was aware it had been spotted and began to maneuver across my path approximately 200 to 500 ft away, it was difficult to judge the distance because of the darkness around. i than noticed the large red fireball was in fact three red fireballs that pulsated in a triangular pattern. the object hovered ahead over the trees i lost sight of the object twice before losing it at the buildings downtown.  the object was completely silent all that could be heard was my heavy breathing as i attempted to chase this object on my beachcruiser. i had no fear whatsoever if anything i felt as though it was going to be there. in otherwords i wasn't surprised at all. as i pursued the object i was either lost in concentration or excitement with a hint of shock. when i reached my destination i told my fianc��� about the incident.  we drove home without further incident while she related to me her disappointment for not being present to witness the event. ironically enough she was fortunate enough to see the object again the next night at around the same time. i will file a seperate report for that sighting. thank you
content.summary: Spotted a triangular object hovering over bitteroot river.

content.detailedDescription:
August 28, 2011 (1:15 a.M. pst) 8:15 gmt (+/- 5 mins).  enjoying the stars sitting in my  backyard looking up towards venus in the ne crystal clear cloudless night sky.  to my delight almost directly overhead, i peripherally notice what i assume is a meteor streaking across the sky.  i snap up to look with my 20/20 vision and i am stunned to see an amber glowing orb with no trail behind it streaking as fast as a shooting star but in steady level flight without loss of altitude characteristic of controlled flight.  speed was many multiples faster than any satellite i have ever seen ��� unfathomable speed.  directly overhead i see a faintly glowing translucent diamond shaped aura around the brightly glowing amber orb.  the speed was mind bending fast and the object appeared to strobe as it streaked across the sky, but i believe that was an optical illusion caused by the best my eyes could humanly compute to track the streaking object (anyone who has seen a military air show has witnessed this when the air craft dive down high and fast swooping towards the stands).  once the high flying object was heading away from me and no longer directly overhead i no longer witnessed a strobe effect or the diamond amber aura, however the bright amber glowing orb remained distinctly defined for the entire observation.  at this point i conclude it must be one of the experimental darpa/usaf htv-2 hypersonic aircraft launched out of vandenberg.  that theory was shaken about two seconds later when i am stunned to see an absolute identical amber orb object traveling at the same mind bending speed coming head on towards the east bound object separated by only a few degrees from my point of observation.

a moment before the objects would cross paths in the sky, the east bound object (the first observed) turns a slight few degrees away from the others path, then pulls a sudden sharp 90 degree perfect semi-circle turn to the south (with the grace of a jet fighter at warp speed).  the object glows brighter through the turn with no signs of decelerating while maintaining its stunning speed through the turn.  an impossible maneuver that was hard for my mind to process ��� it felt disorientating to take in (did not compute).   it now heads southward but for a second or two and snap turns 90 degrees back east-bound accelerating and then fading away into the horizon as if in warp speed (almost looked like the object dropped straight down, but i think that was an illusion due to my perspective looking at it now far and low in the distance).  intuitively i was left feeling that the maneuvers between the two craft were playful in nature like a quantum cat and mouse game.  i stopped tracking the second object at the point the two cross paths as they were moving too fast and in opposing directions, i had to pick one to focus on and never got another glimps of it.

i futilely looked to the sky for more of these orbs for about fifteen minutes before the elation of what i just saw was fully absorbed and turned to feelings of being completely creeped out.  like a child afraid of the dark i rushed inside the house.  i woke my wife in her deep sleep in an attempt to convince her i just saw something profound and fantastically unbelievable.  she believes me, god bless her.

it all happened very fast.  come daylight i repeatedly recalled the event with times my mental replays with a stopwatch.  from this excercise i concluded the entire event was witnessed for a total of about 12 and 15 seconds.  about 3 to 5 seconds in when the second craft was observed coming straight for the first and about 2 seconds later when the objects crossed paths and the first object commenced its first turn.  that first 90 degree turn took about 3 seconds to complete but at the same mind bending constant speed it had at straight flight.  a few seconds later it snap turns 90 degrees back east bound and fades lighting fast into the horizon. 

this was no laser, the sky was clear, the objects had dimension, and a laser is not going to deliver a show so crisp and demensional on a clear night  all the way to the horizon.  meteors do not look or behave like this nor do they defy the laws of physics.  chinese lanterns or flares....Lol...No way.  

only those of us that have seen these objects can possibly understand.  i certainly didn't believe until just a few days ago that we may not be alone.  i wish i never witnessed this event  in that i now have the burden of keeping it to myself or being stigmatized as part of the lunatic fringe only to hear,  ���i believe you believe you saw something���.

impossible physics ��� impossible propulsion.  pray these things are made in america by darpa, but i doubt it.   in the few days i have spent researching similar sightings as mine, most of what is being reported involve orange/amber orbs and almost always two or more, not just one.  that is odd to me and does not add up for this being earth bound particularly so in that most sightings of these amber orbs usually involve two or more objects interacting and driven by propulsion systems of unbound energy.  darpa's crafts are one time shots lasting minutes and only a handful have been launched.   if this technology is human, it is such that it is breaking the known laws of physics and humanity deserves to know more about it.  if what we are witnessing are objects from another world, our governments certainly know it and humanity deserves full disclosure.
 
mark my words, if you haven���t seen these amber orbs yet, it is only a matter of time before you do.
content.summary: Two amber glowing orbs flying at mind bending speed approach from opposite directions and make physics defying maneuvers

content.detailedDescription: I was on my home from 24 hour fitness off cooper street and took interstate 20 home, as i was approaching the exit i noticed a bright white light in the sky but it looked kind of low and i just assumed it was an airplane.  i really did not think anything of it until i observed this light then immediatley turn red, then green and blue.  as i was coming up to the light on park springs i observed the object fly over me where i notice that it was not an airplane and was more cigar shaped. i then turned around to try and follow the object but by the time that happened which was a matter of seconds, the object was already gone.
content.summary: Ufo over i20 in arlington, tx

content.detailedDescription:
1- i was home and decided to look out my living room window like usual, and look at the night sky like i do every night.

2- i looked out the window and glanced at the night sky before i started looking at stars and i saw a few stars and a very bright one, i glance at the other side of the sky then look back to the other side to realize the bright star moved from its position a bit so i started looking at it and i saw it was moving. i called my mom over to see it and she saw it as well.

3- what i thought the object was a plane or a helicopter.

4- the object was as bright as a bright star but a little brighter. i noticed it didnt have red/green lights or blinking lights like aircraft should have. the object was moving in a straight direction (moving from west to east). i opened the window to hear nothing coming from it. then i said in my head " ufo? alien life? government test?"

5- what i felt was anxiousness to know what it was that was just a moving light with no sound. what i did during the sighting was just stand at the window with my mom and watch it till i couldnt see it anymore because of my buildings shape. so the building got in my way to view it longer. after the sighting i went online to search if anyone else saw this before or even when i saw it. a tweet on twitter said "there was a strange light in the sky tonight, not a star but not a helicopter, had no sound just slow moving ball of fire."
content.summary: I thought it was a bright star till i realized it was moving

content.detailedDescription: Looking in the sky from an upstairs window of my house, which is located in redwood city, ca, i saw an airplane pass by overhead. after the plane had passed, i noticed an object that was flying erratically in no specific flight plan, almost wobbling up and down. the object changed in color in no apparent pattern from red to blue to white. the object did not fly smoothly downward or across the sky as a meteor or shooting star would. it did not look like a helicopter or other craft, and it did not make a sound. i brought my daughter to the window and she also observed this strange flying craft. it appeared orb shaped. we watched the object for approximately 3 minutes and it then disappeared from view. my daughter said that she could not believe what she saw, that it looked like a star that was moving.
content.summary: Erratically flying object alternately blinking red blue white

content.detailedDescription:
My ufo sighting happened while i was driving on hwy 820 in fort worth.
(the sky was free of clouds.)

i was on my way to trade school and concentrating on the traffic and listening to the radio.  all of a sudden my attention was captured by a bright light in the sky.  the light made an abrupt movement and quickly disappeared.  

i had an immediate process of deduction going through my mind following the sighting.  i told myself that it couldn't have been an airplane, helicopter etc...Becauce it was so unbelievably fast.  and the light was so brilliant and its movement was not like a normal aircraft.  

i distinctly had a feeling that what ever it was did no really want to be seen.  and i did not get to see it very long at all. but i do know that i saw something that to this very day make me wonder deeply about reality.  i became alot more passionate about topics involving ancient egypt, stonehenge, crop circles, nazca lines ... history channel programs.  

at the trade school, while in computer class, i did mention to a classmate what i had witnessed earlier while driving and other classmates heard the conversation and rudely made fun of me for telling about my ufo account.  i felt slightly embarrassed but quickly shrugged it off.  i couldn't allow any one to shame me into thinking that what i saw was just my imagination.           

during my sighting i never became afraid only bewildered and mesmerized.

in less than 10 years i had a second sighting.  this occurrence i was a passenger in my sister's car.  she was driving.  we were traveling south bound on 360 and just having a normal conversation. at the same time our attention was drawn to a bright light in a clear night sky.  the light moved simular to my first sighting and i was once again amazed.  i had to calm my sister down.  she asked me "did you see that?"  and i replied "remember i told you i saw a ufo before and you didn't believe me?...Now you got to see what i saw! she told me that she couldn't hardly drive because her leg was shaking so bad and she said it felt like her heart was beating out of her chest!  i asked her to calm down because it was gone.  she then said "we can't tell any body about this 'cause they'll think that we're crazy.  i told her i knew, i had already found that out but that i didn't care what others thought.  

anyway,  that's what i remember.  thanks for the opportunity to share with others.  sincerely,  salem
content.summary: Bright light with abrupt down then up and out of sight movement and a speed that seems incalculable.  unforgettable in every way mainly because there's is nothing to compare it to.

content.detailedDescription:
1st sighting: my father had called me outside to see something "strange" and that's when i noticed a craft that had a blinking red light that would blink consecutively and it appeared to go from one point in the sky to another far off point really fast and that's when i noticed that this was not a craft ive seen before. 
2nd sighting: i had went inside again to get something and my father had told my sister about what he had seen. she went outside and he immediately followed minutes later i decided to go back outside as well. we were looking up at the sky and that's when we saw the red blinking lights again coming from a different direction and again this craft emitted no sound which was odd for a craft of this size. my sister and i in a futile attempt to get close to it decided to chase after this craft.. that's when we got a closer look at it and noticed that this craft was not an airplane or a helicopter. it was triangular in shape and had 3 lights in the back and a red blinking light in the center. as we chased it we noticed that it did not make a sound and that it just glided in the air like a kite. then we saw it turn abruptly as if it was going to go back around but at that precise moment it disappeared behind a house in our neighborhood.
content.summary: Saw triangular craft gliding over our neighborhood and it made no sound.

content.detailedDescription: The only reason i am posting this is because i saw similar postings. my husband, sister along with myself were sitting on the back patio monday night around 9:30pm and i saw a very bright white light coming from the west, heading east, shaped like a star. it appeared to be wobbling, almost traveling snakelike across the sky. i was looking straight up at it and it was probably between 500 and a 1000 feet up. i told my sister and husband to look at it and asked them if they thought it was a plane because i didn't. they didn't know what it was either and it made no noise. we studied it for about a minute, the my husband started to make fun of me about it being a ufo but i told him it looked like it was wobbling and he said,"yeah, you're right, it is." as it moved more east it suddenly dimmed then completely dissappeared. we had observed a plane traveling west at the same time and knew what that was immediately. we sat there for a few minutes discussing what we saw and we don't have a clue. it was such a brillant bright light and the experienced lasted around 4 or 5 minutes. we never saw it reappear. i wish i had got a photo of it but by the time i thought about it, it had disappeared.
content.summary: Very bright white light that was ball/star shaped

content.detailedDescription:
I know this is a long time ago, but it always eats away at me that i haven't "reported" it. i have told many people of it, but have not known of mufon until now, so here goes...

i was riding in the car with my mother at the time on blue ridge road here in raleigh, nc when i looked to my left over the trees and noticed a grey disc hovering approximately where crabtree valley mall is located. it was a classic disc shape with a dome above...As a matter a fact very similar to the mufon logo as i am looking at it now. i always smile when i think of how "stereotypical" ufo shape it was...Just like something you would see in a movie.  when i was young i had 20/10 vision and i know for a fact it was something with which i was not familiar; not then, not now. i was in a moving car at the time but i definitely could tell it was moving to the right a bit before hovering again. 

i excitedly told my mother, who was trying to drive the car safely, but as she attempted to look, the car was still moving when the viewing angle became obscured by trees. this event changed my life as simple as it was. i am much more skeptical what i am told, and much more open-minded to the other things we are not told.
content.summary: Disc hovered, moved to the right a bit and i lost it in the trees as i was moving in a car.

content.detailedDescription: i was leaving my house at approx 8:40 pm and noticed that the large star-like orb seen for the last two nights was still there but much larger.  it was in the eastern sky after the sun set at about 70 degrees.  i didn't expect anything but it suddenly started to descend.  i ran inside to grab the camcorder and managed to get very little of its descent, as by that time it was fading as it seemed to get further away as though it was moving to the southeast.  shortly after, about 3 minutes, there was what looked like a meteor traveling the same southeast direction (about 1 second with a very short trail) but at a very low altitude (lower than the orb).
content.summary: Large star-like orb seen for 2 nights suddenly descended then faded  towards the southeast

content.detailedDescription: We were without power for 3 days due to hurricane irene. the power was restored this afternoon. after getting home from work, i coiled up my extension cords and put away the generator.  i shut off the lights to the garage and went to close my tailgate on my truck. i decided to finish my bottle of beer while sitting on the tailgate. very clear night. it was almost 9pm and lots of stars in the sky. i only had 1 bottle.  and i may drink zero, one, or two 12oz bottles per week. not a drinker. i turned back toward the cab of the truck, then slowly scanned the sky.  no airplanes. but then i saw one over my neighbor mary's house. it must be a plane. but it seemed to be much brighter and whiter. and bigger. it was traveling east, away from me. kind of slow and straight, like a plane. but why would i see bright headlights if it was traveling away from me? this puzzled me, so i kept staring at it. i still can't seem to see any blinking lights on it. i've seen those bag lanterns people light and send off to the sky. this was way too bright and white to be one of those. then something bizarre happened, which is why i am submitting this report. the light wavered back and forth slightly a few times, then started to shrink. it shrunk down to a little orange/red dot, then disappeared. i mean gone. poof. what the heck? where did it go? it's not like it went behind some trees and i lost sight of it. it was right up there in the sky.  i looked around the sky again searching for anything that might be moving. nothing. that was bizarre.
content.summary: White light traveling east. wavered a little, shrunk to a red dot, then disappeared.

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting at the light coming out of the home depot on route 70 in cherry hill. it was a gorgeous day and there was little cloud cover. 

i happened to look up towards the southeast and saw an unidentified flying object. 

i can't really estimate distance... it was probably a few miles away at a height of at least 10,000 feet. 

it was a silver cigar-shaped object. pointed on both ends. i supposed it could have been a flying saucer being viewed from the side.

it was moving at a steady, non-hurried pace for about 4 seconds and then it simply disappeared. it didn't accelerate suddenly or change directions - it simply popped out of existence. 

i kept staring at that part of the sky for another 30 seconds but saw nothing else. 

i don't believe this was a plane or a jet. i've seen jets leave vapor trails and there was none. there wasn't a cloud in that part of the sky. no other aircraft. it was a silver object moving in a general northern direction and after a few seconds - poof. it was just gone.

i keep an open mind with regards to ufo's. this is the first time i've seen an object in the sky i could not identify.

hoping some other people may have spotted this object for corraberation.
content.summary: Silver cigar-shaped ufo

content.detailedDescription: At 2040 hours local mountain time.  i looked up and saw two very bright objects almost directly overhead.  they appeared very star-like in their color and luminositiy.  around 80 degree above the horizon.  they were traveling south by southwest.  they were moving at the same speed.  just slightly faster than the speed a satellite will track across the sky.  the brightest one was the most southern one.  their distance was (fully extend your arm above you, give the peace sign, the distance from index to middle finger was the distance seperating these objects).  the flight charcteristcs were very similar to watching the iss fly over.  but i have never seen saltellites travel in a pair before, on the same trajectory and speed.  in perfect formation.  these lights were visible for around a minute and a half. i started my visual track when they were already almost directly overhead.  weird huh.  if you have multiple witnesses or know what this is, please let me know.

We observed a large white object in the sky. at first it appeared to be a satellite, but it was much larger and much brighter than satellites are. it was definitely at a high distance in the sky, but appeared to be lowered than airplanes, which were also visible at higher altitudes. the object glowed all white, but brighter than a full moon appears. there were no flashing red/green lights as used by aircraft or helicopters and the object was closer than other airplanes in the sky at the time, whose red/green flashing lights we could clearly see. 

at first, the movement was smooth and in one direction, moving from northern sky to southern sky. then the object changed direction and headed west briefly. then it reversed direction and began heading east. the changes in movement were abrupt, but appeared to occur smoothly. then the object stopped completely. a dead stop. we watched it completely motionless for about 20 to 30 seconds. as we were discussing what we were watching, the object distinctly rose directly into the sky, straight up from where it had been stopped, becoming smaller and smaller and smaller, eventually becoming just a small red dot - and then it vanished. 

there was no sound of any kind. 

the entire observation lasted about two minutes for me, three minutes for my daughter who first saw it moving and called me. 

this is the second time i have seen a ufo, but my previous experience was in 1977 and i was laughed at when i tried to report it to the police. i was also ridiculed back then by friends and others, so i stopped talking about it. there was no place to make a report like i am making now.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Large white orb in the sky that changed direction then rose into sky

content.detailedDescription: My roommate and i were sitting in our front lawn talking and an extremely bright light caught my attention.  we had thought we had seen a satellite moving northwest to southeast across the sky roughly ten minutes earlier and i thought, at first, that maybe what i saw was a shooting star or some other thing entering the atmosphere.  i looked up and told my roommate to look up immediately.  what i saw was the most astonishing bright white light i had ever seen.  it was moving slowly across the sky from southeast to northwest.  as i watched the object, it appeared to be experiencing a rotation along its yaw axis because the bright white seemed to dim with the same characteristic one might see when a flashlight is turned away from them.  the light was still visible but it was much dimmer as it seemed to rotate.  we continued to watch, though it was much dimmer than when we first caught sight of it.  and as we watched, we saw the bright white light roll back over so we could see it.  it lasted for possibly 10 seconds in its brightest visible position.  it continued to rotate and we lost sight of it.  it must have been extremely high.  we noticed no noise nor did we notice any vapor trail.  also, it was moving extremely slowly across the sky.  as we sat in our chairs, not moving, i would say we saw it cover about 15% of the nighttime sky before we lost sight in an event that took perhaps three minutes at the very most.  it was, without a doubt, the most brilliant, clear, white light i had ever seen.  these were not landing lights as it seemed to project straight down and it gave off no halogen luminosity.  also, because it seemed to rotate along the roll axis, i do not see how it could be landing lights which point straight ahead (also, due to the extreme altitude of this light, landing lights seem impractical for any aircraft at that point).  also, because there were no flashing lights visible, like an airplane might have, we thought it might have been a reflecting satellite but i have never, ever, seen anything so brilliant.  it was the size of a pinhead but it was as bright as any xenon headlight i've seen except it was perfectly white in color.
content.summary: Fluctuating bright white light appeared to exhibit a rotation on they roll axis moving slowly across sky.

content.detailedDescription:
Last saturday night, three of my friends and i went for a walk on our college campus down to the bay (our campus is on the gulf coast of florida). it was about 10pm, and totally dark. we were standing by the water trying to look at the stars- there weren't many. the night was overcast and it had been rainy all day. we were mostly hanging out, joking around. none of us were intoxicated. i saw a bright light from north of where we were standing, and i actually jokingly said that it was a ufo. once everybody was focusing on the object, we became confused about what it could be- it wasn't too far from us, but it was moving very, very slowly. as we watched, it began to make a zig-zag pattern over the water, at times heading right towards us. it was definitely less than a mile away, but we couldn't hear anything. our campus is right next to an airport, so we are all very familiar with the noises that various objects in flight make-- this object was entirely silent. 
it continued to travel slowly, zig-zagging across the bay, in our direction. there were no other lights on the craft other than the main brightest white one, and the object appeared to be triangular in shape.
we were standing next to a copse of trees which separated the campus from a nearby neighborhood. the copse of trees is very small- maybe as wide as an average sized house. the ufo descended just beyond the trees and landed, very slowly and silently. 

we didn't go into the trees to investigate because we were unsure of what the object could be. we didn't feel threatened- mostly just in awe.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Other
content.summary: It zig-zagged very slowly across the bay, then landed beyond nearby trees.
